VariableDeclarationConverter module

class VariableDeclarationConverter.VariableDeclarationConverter[source]

Bases: object

A class responsible for converting variable declarations into Z3 solver compatible format.

This class provides static methods to convert variable declarations from a custom format into Z3 declarations, handling different data types including integers, strings, booleans, sets, arrays, and participant types. It supports initial value assignment and checks for correct syntax using a pattern checker.

convert_assignements_to_z3_assignment()[source]

Converts assignment statements into Z3 assignment format.

Parameters:

declarations_str (str) – String containing assignment declarations separated by ‘&’ symbols.

Returns:

A string containing the converted Z3 assignment statements.

Return type:

str

static convert_to_z3_declarations(declarations_str, deploy_init_var_val=[], var_names={}, deploy=False)[source]

Converts variable declarations into Z3 declarations with optional initial values.

Parameters:

  • declarations_str (str) – String containing variable declarations separated by semicolons or commas.

  • deploy_init_var_val (list) – List to append initial values of variables for deployment.

  • var_names (dict) – Dictionary to map variable names to their types.

  • deploy (bool) – Flag to indicate if the conversion is for deployment purposes.

Returns:

A tuple containing the Z3 declarations as a string, a list of initial values for deployment, a dictionary of variable names and types, and a dictionary of participant variables.

Return type:

tuple[str, list, dict, dict]
